reference.title: nodeadmin-pack-instance
reference.shortdesc: The nodeadmin-pack-instance command allows you to migrate instances offline from one Node Controller (NC) to another. It packs an instance from libvirt and places the output artifacts into a packed file.

row.entry: Display the manual page for the command.

Pack all the instances on the node controller (NC).
* Must specify one option: all or a specific instance.

Name of the source instance to pack and the name of the output file.
* Must specify one option: all or a specific instance.

Location to store the resulting packed file(s).
If you do not specify an output directory, the default is where you run the command.
The default is to suspend the instance during the pack operation. If you want to shut down the instance before packing, include this option.
If you want to see more details and progress during the pack operation, include this option.
The default is to compress the packed output to minimize the file size. However, this takes more time. If time is more important than output size, include this option.

The host and port of the Storage Controller (SC).
To find these, run from the CLC: euserv-describe-services --filter service-type=storage --expert (one per zone)

Path to the root of the Eucalyptus installation, which is system root / for a package-based installation, must be set so that the cryptographic credentials can be found.
Default: EUCALYPTUS=/

The dynamic library search path must be set to include several Axis2 libraries.
Default: LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$AXIS2C_HOME/lib:$AXIS2C_HOME/modules/rampart

section.title: Output
section.p: returns a message stating that the instance was packed and output to the directory you specified.
